intro: Hypolytrum longirostre, commonly known as the long-beaked spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with erect, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in dense clusters along the stem. Hypolytrum longirostre plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
